Backstab.name: Backstab
Backstab.blurb: Shaco's basic attack critically strikes for extra damage when striking a unit from behind. Units can't be Backstabbed more than once every few seconds, modified by Shaco's cooldown reduction.
Backstab.description: Innate: Shaco's basic attacks deal an additional 10 − 25 (based on level) (+ 15% bonus AD) bonus physical damage when striking an enemy from behind. This damage can  critically strike.
Backstab.description2: Deceive and  Two-Shiv Poison also have additional effects when striking an enemy from behind.
Backstab.notes: * Backstab does not affect structures (turrets, inhibitors, Nexus).

Deceive.name: Deceive
Deceive.blurb: Shaco becomes Invisible and teleports to target location.
Deceive.description: Active: After a 0.125-second delay, Shaco  blinks  to the target location, temporarily becoming  invisible for a few seconds.
Deceive.description2: After exiting invisibility, his next basic attack within 0.25 seconds deals bonus physical damage. This damage can  critically strike.
Deceive.description3: Deceive's  invisibility is not removed when Shaco casts  Hallucinate, while casting  Jack in the Box causes him to shimmer without removing it.
Deceive.description4: Backstab: Guarantees the basic attack to  critically strike for (30% +  25%) bonus physical damage.
Deceive.notes:
* Deceive's cast animation (an orange puff of smoke) can be seen by both teams through fog of war.
  Teleport can be used during the invisibility without cancelling it. However  Recall cannot.
 PENDING FOR TEST: Enhanced attack's interactions with  dodging,  blocking, and  blinding effects.

Jack in the Box.name: Jack in the Box
Jack in the Box.blurb: Shaco creates a hidden animated Jack-in-the-Box. When triggered, it will fear and attack nearby enemies.
Jack in the Box.description: Active: Shaco summons a Jack in the Box at the target location, lasting for up to 40 (+ 5% AP) seconds. The box arms after a 2 second delay, becoming  stealthed and  untargetable to enemies.
Jack in the Box.description2: Triggering the box will  startle nearby enemies for 0.5 seconds as well as cause them to turn and  flee for 2 seconds, reduced against champions. While fleeing,  minions and  monsters have a static 60  movement speed and  champions have a static 100  movement speed.
Jack in the Box.description3: Once triggered, the box will also become targetable and automatically starts firing every 0.5 seconds at all nearby  visible enemies, dealing  magic damage with each attack, reduced by 50% against  structures. If the box attacks only one unit, it deals increased damage.
Jack in the Box.description4: The box can attack up to 10 times and stays active for 5 seconds or until destroyed, independently from its remaining inactive duration.
Jack in the Box.notes:
* The box applies  persistent damage to enemies in an  area of effect range.
 The flee starts at the same time as the startle, but since the target cannot move while startled the effective duration of the flee is reduced by the startle's.
 Static movement speed cannot be modified (e.g. with  slow resist or  Ghost).
 This effect is negated only if the target is fully slow immune.

 Upon becoming  stealthed, the box creates a puff of smoke and a distinct sound that can be detected through the fog of war.

Two-Shiv Poison.name: Two-Shiv Poison
Two-Shiv Poison.blurb: Shaco's Shivs passively poison targets on hit, slowing their movement speed. He can throw his Shivs to deal damage and poison the target. The thrown Shiv deals bonus damage based on the target's missing Health.
Two-Shiv Poison.description: Passive: Shaco's basic attacks  slow enemies for 2 seconds while Two-Shiv Poison is off cooldown.
Two-Shiv Poison.description2: Active: Shaco throws a dagger at the target enemy,  slowing them for 3 seconds and dealing magic damage, increased by 50% against targets below 30% of their maximum health.
Two-Shiv Poison.description3: Backstab: Deals an additional 15 − 50 (based on level) (+ 10% AP) bonus magic damage, increased to 22.5 − 75 (based on level) (+ 15% AP) when the target is below 30% of their maximum health.

Hallucinate.name: Hallucinate
Hallucinate.blurb: Shaco creates an illusion of himself near him, which can attack nearby enemies (Deals reduced damage to turrets). Upon death, it explodes, spawning three mini Jack in the Boxes and dealing damage to nearby enemies.
Hallucinate.description: First Cast: Shaco  vanishes for 0.5 seconds and then  blinks in the target direction while creating a clone of himself that blinks in the opposite direction, remaining within tether range of him as a controllable  pet for up to 18 seconds.
Hallucinate.description2: Second Cast: While the Hallucination is active, Hallucinate can be used to move it to the target location.
Hallucinate.description3: When the Hallucination dies or expires, it explodes, dealing magic damage to enemy units around it and leaving three  mini-boxes behind which activate instantly, causing nearby enemies to  flee for 1 second.
Hallucinate.description4: The three boxes possess Jack in the Box's effects, except they have a doubled, but shared  health, and deal modified magic damage with each attack, increased if attacking a single unit.
Hallucinate.notes:
* Shaco and the Hallucination will face each other the moment of their appearance.
 The clone uses  pet damage.
 The Hallucination's  explosion applies  area damage.
 The summoned boxes deal  persistent damage in an  area of effect range.
